autoArchiveTooltip.title: Why automatic archiving?
autoArchiveTooltip.description: Automatic archiving keeps the backlog readable by archiving tasks that haven't been touched in a long time.
autoArchiveTooltip.why: Some tasks lose their relevance. Rather than cluttering the backlog, they are archived. Archiving is not deletion: you can find these tasks via filters and unarchive them if needed.
autoArchiveTooltip.config: You can adjust the archive delay in the column settings (0 to disable). Clicking "Extend" resets the counter and postpones the archive.

tooltip.title: What is snooze?
tooltip.description: Snoozing allows you to temporarily hide a backlog task until a chosen date. During this time, the task doesn't appear in the column, but an icon counter shows how many tasks are snoozed. You can view and modify these tasks anytime via the filters panel.

autoArchiveTooltip.title: Why automatic archiving?
autoArchiveTooltip.description: Automatic archiving frees up the "Done" column so you can truly see what was recently completed.
autoArchiveTooltip.why: Completed tasks accumulate quickly. Automatic archiving keeps the column readable by moving old tasks to the archive. Archiving is not deletion: you can find these tasks via filters and unarchive them if needed.
autoArchiveTooltip.config: You can adjust the archive delay in the column settings (0 to disable). Clicking "Extend" resets the counter and postpones the archive.

search.title: Task search
search.body: Search for tasks using text search. You need a minimum of 3 characters for the search to launch automatically. There are special codes: @ to search in names, # to search in task numbers, ! in priorities.
search.hint: Stack quick filters or advanced filters with the query to narrow the board in seconds.

effort.body: Filter tasks by their estimated complexity (from XS for very simple to XXL for very complex). Useful for isolating quick tasks when you have little time or heavy tasks when planning your sprint.

add.title: Create a column
add.body: Click the plus button to add a new column, then describe how it should behave.
add.hint: You can adjust the configuration later without losing any card.

name.title: Column name
name.body: Choose a short and clear name that reflects the step in your workflow (e.g., To Do, In Progress, Review, Done). The name can be changed at any time without impacting tasks.

behavior.title: Column behavior
behavior.body:
You have 4 possible behaviors:

‚Ä¢ Backlog: This is where you place new tasks. You can choose the number of days after which tasks automatically move to archive (set to zero to disable). To extend a task's life, there's a button in the task editor. You can also use snooze mode to temporarily hide a task until a chosen date.

‚Ä¢ In Progress: No automated behavior for now.

‚Ä¢ Blocked: A blocked task reveals 3 new fields: email, message, and delay in days. You can provide the blocker's email with a message, and an email will be sent every X days. Let the tool quietly harass the blocker, or decide to spam yourself.

‚Ä¢ Done: You can define the number of days after which Done tasks move to archive.
behavior.hint: You can have multiple columns with the same behavior: for example 3 Backlog columns ("Project Backlog", "Technical Backlog", "Bug Backlog") or multiple "In Progress" ("In Progress", "In Testing"). Adapt the behavior to your needs.

wip.title: WIP (Work In Progress) limit
wip.body: Set a maximum number of tasks for this column. As soon as the limit is exceeded, a visual warning appears to encourage you to finish what's started before starting new tasks. Leave 0 for no limit.
wip.hint: WIP is a key Kanban principle: limiting work in progress improves focus and reduces delivery time.

name.title: Column name
name.body: You can rename a column at any time, without breaking tasks or workflow. Useful for adapting terminology as your process evolves.

wip.title: WIP limit
wip.body: Adjust the limit when team capacity changes. Leave 0 to remove all limits. A limit too low blocks work, a limit too high dilutes focus.
wip.hint: Start with a limit equal to the number of people on the team, then adjust based on results.

backlogArchive.title: Auto-archive (backlog)
backlogArchive.body: Choose after how many days of inactivity backlog tasks move to the archive automatically. Leave 0 to disable. If you want to keep a card in the backlog, use the Snooze or Keep button directly on the card.
backlogArchive.hint: A self-cleaning backlog avoids accumulation of obsolete tasks. Recommendation: 30 to 90 days.

doneArchive.title: Auto-archive (done)
doneArchive.body: Define after how many days completed tasks leave the DONE column. Helps keep the column readable while preserving history in the archive.
doneArchive.hint: Keep Done tasks visible for a few days to celebrate wins! Recommendation: 7 to 14 days.

id.title: Short ID
id.body: The short number (like #55) makes it easy to reference the card in a meeting, slack, or search. Click it to copy the full URL with the ID.

priority.title: Priority badge
priority.body: Color-coded priority badge. Click to change the priority level.

menu.title: Quick actions
menu.body: Display actions on the task: open in full-screen, rename, move to another board, delete.
menu.hint: Handy when drag-and-drop is not practical or you need advanced actions.
menu.info: Opens shortcuts to edit, move or archive the card.

assignees.title: Assignees
assignees.body: Initials of people involved in the task. In normal mode, hover to display RACI roles (Responsible, Accountable, Consulted, Informed) for each person.
assignees.hint: Use this to quickly know who does what without opening the task.
assignees.info: Hover the avatars to view each RACI role.

dueDate.title: Due date
dueDate.body: Target date for completing the task. In normal mode, the tooltip shows the complete formatted date. A color code helps you prioritize: green = on time, orange = tight, red = overdue.
dueDate.hint: Use it in combination with the due-date sort to see urgent tasks at the top.

progress.title: Progress
progress.body: Percentage of completion automatically calculated based on subtasks or workflow status. In normal mode, the tooltip shows the exact percentage.

effort.title: Effort
effort.body: Estimated complexity: XS (very simple) to XXL (very complex). Allows you to filter tasks by size and plan your capacity.

fractal.title: Fractal / Child kanban
fractal.body: This icon indicates that the task has its own child kanban board. The 4 numbers show: backlog, in progress, blocked, done. In normal mode, the tooltip displays the exact count for each state.
fractal.hintExisting: Click to open the child board and follow its progress.
fractal.hintCreate: If no board exists yet, we will create it instantly for you.
